gurmukhi: joq ijqI Ar BIqr QI su sBY muK sXwm ky bIc smwnI ] bol skY n rhy cup huie kib sXwm khY ju bfy AiBmwnI ]
transliteration: Jot Jitiar Bheetar Tthisu Sabhai Mmoukh Syaam Ke Beech Samaanibol Sakai Na Rahe Choup Hue Kabbi Syaam Kahai Ju Bade Abhimaanee||
translation: Whatever power was there in Shishupal, the same got merged in the face of Krishna, many proud warriors there sat silently,

gurmukhi: bwNko blI isspwl hnXo ijh kI huqI cMdÍqI rjDwnI ] Xw sm Aaur n koaU bIXo jg sRI jdubIr shI pRBu jwnI ]2344]
transliteration: Baanko Balisispaal Hanyo Jih Kihoutichanndravatirajdhaanee|| Yaa Sam Aur Na Ko( i)  Beeyo Jag Srijadoubeer Sahiprabh(u) Jaanee||2344||
translation: Shishupal, the very powerful man of Chanderi had been killed by Krishna; everybody agreed that there was no one so mighty as Krishna in the world.2344.

gurmukhi: eyk khY jdurwie bfo Bt jwih blI sspwl so GwXo ] ieMdR qy sUrj qy jm qy huqo jwq n so jmlok pTwXo ]
transliteration: Ek Kahai Jaduraae Bado Bhat Jaah((i) Balisaspaal So Ghaayo|| Indra Te Sooraj Te Jam Te Houto Jaat Na So Jamlok Pathaayo||
translation: Everyone said that Krishna was the most powerful hero, who had killed the mighty warrior like Shishupal, who was even unconquerable for Indra, Surya and Yama;

gurmukhi: so ieh eyk hI AwNK ky Por kY BIqr mwr dXo jIA AwXo ] caudh lokh ko krqw kr sRI biRjnwQ shI ThrwXo ]2345]
transliteration: So Eh Ek Hiaankh Ke Phor Kai Bheetar Maar Jeea Aayo|| Chaudah Lokh Ko Martaa Kar Sribrijnaath Sahithahraayo||2345||
translation: He had killed that enemy in the winking of an eye and the same Krishna is the creator of all the fourteen worlds.2345.

gurmukhi: caudh lokn ko krqw ieh swDn sMq iehY jIA jwnXo ] dyv Adyv kIey sB XwhI ky byd n qy gun jwin bKwnXo ]
transliteration: Chaudah Lokan Ko Kartaa Eh Saadan Sant Ihai Jeea Jaanyo|| Dev Adev Keee Sabh Yaahike Bed Na Te Goun Jaan(i) Bakhaanyo||
translation: Krishna is the Lord of all the fourteen worlds, all the saints accept this; the gods and others are all created by him and the Vedas also describe His attributes;

gurmukhi: bIrn bIr bfo eI lKXo hir BUpn BUpn qy KunswnXo ] Aaur ijqy Air TwFy huqo iqn sXwm shI kir kwl pCwnXo ]2346]
transliteration: Bderan Beer Bado Ilakhyo Har(i) Bhoopan Bhoopan Te Khounsaanyo|| Aur Jite Ar(i) Thaadhe Houto Tin Syaam Sahikar(i) Kaal Pachhaadyo||2346||
translation: Krishna who also gets enraged on the kings, was considered the mighty hero amongst the warriors and all the enemies recognised him, in reality, as the manifestation of Death.2346.

gurmukhi: sRI biRjnwiek TwNF qhwN kr bIc sudrSn ckR lIey ] bhu ros Tny Aiq kRoD BrXo Air Awn ko Awnq hY n hIey ]
transliteration: Sribrijnaaik Thaandh Tahaan Kar Beech Sudarshan Chakr Leee|| Bahu Ros Thane At(i) Krodh Bdaryo Ar(i) Aan Ko Aanat Hai Na Heee||
translation: Krishna was standing there, holding his discus in his hand; he was extremely angry and in that state of enragement, he did not remember any other enemy;

gurmukhi: iqh Taur sBw hU mY gwjq BXo sB kwlih ko mno ByK kIey ] ijh dyKq pRwn qjY Airvw bhu sMq inhwr kY rUp jIey ]2347]
transliteration: Tih Thaur Sabhaa Hoo Mai Gadjat Bhyo Sabh Kaalah(i) Ko Mano Bhekh Keee|| Jih Dekhat Praan Tajai Arivaa Bahu Sant Nihaar Kai Roop Jeee||2347||
translation: He, as manifestation of Death, was thundering in the Court; he was such a one, seeing whom, the enemies embrace death and the saints, on seeing him, were resuscitated.2347.

gurmukhi: Awp hI BUp khI auT kY kir joir doaU pRB kRoD invwro ] Qo isspwl bfo Kl so qum ckiH lY iCn mwih sMGwro ]
transliteration: Oop Hibhoop Kahiouth Kai Kar(i) Jor(i) Dooo Prabh Krodh Nidaro|| Tho Sispaal Bado Khal So Toum Chakrah(i) Lai Chhin Maah(i) Sandaro||
translation: The king Yudhishtra said with folded hands, “O Lord ! forsake anger, Shishupal was a great tyrant, you have performed a noble task by killing him;”

gurmukhi: Xo kih pwie rhXo gih kY duhU Awpny nYnn qy jlu Fwro ] kwnH jU jo qum ros kro qo khw qum so bsu hYb hmwro ]2348]
transliteration: Yo Kah(i) Paae Rahyo Gadh Kai Duhoo Aapane Nainan Te Jal(u) Ddaro|| Kaahn Joo Jo Toum Ros Daro To Kahaa Toum So Bas(u) Haib Hardaro||2348||
translation: Saying this, the king, caught both the feet of Krishna and the tears rolled down his eyes; he said, “O Krishna ! if you get angry, what control can we have over it?”2348.
